comments.opening: Double Wing Attack opening - both players advance their rook pawns for aggressive play.
comments.move_15: Oyama builds a classic Mino Castle for king safety.
comments.move_30: Brilliant defensive move! Oyama's gold general blocks a powerful attack.
comments.move_45: The famous defensive sequence that saved this game. Oyama demonstrates why he's called the 'Divine Mover'.
comments.endgame: A masterclass in defensive technique. Oyama converts a difficult position into a winning endgame.

games.description: One of the most famous defensive games in Shogi history. Yasuharu Oyama, known as the 'Divine Mover', demonstrates extraordinary defensive technique against a fierce attack by Iino. This game is studied for its brilliant defensive moves.

comments.opening: Static Rook vs Ranging Rook - a classic confrontation in Shogi strategy.
comments.move_20: Unexpected move! This game is famous for its humorous and surprising turns.
comments.move_35: The famous 'dancing pieces' sequence begins - pieces moving back and forth in surprising ways.
comments.move_50: Comedy gold! But beneath the humor lies deep strategic understanding.
comments.endgame: Despite the unusual middle game, Habu demonstrates his genius by converting to a winning position.

games.description: A beloved game among Shogi enthusiasts for its unexpected and humorous turns. Despite the comedic elements, it showcases young Habu's exceptional understanding of complex positions. This game became a fan favorite and is often shared for entertainment and educational value.

games.name: The Teenage Prodigy's Brilliancy
games.kifu: P-7f P-8d P-2f P-8e B-7g P-3d P-2e B-3c S-4h S-2b P-5f S-6b K-6h K-4a K-7h G-3b...

comments.opening: Bishop Exchange opening - Fujii's favorite aggressive start.
comments.move_25: This move shocked the professional community! Fujii finds a computer-like solution.
comments.move_40: Unprecedented bishop drop! This move was analyzed for weeks after the game.
comments.move_55: The famous '11-second move' - Fujii plays an incredibly complex combination almost instantly.
comments.endgame: A beautiful forced checkmate sequence. At age 14, Fujii defeats a veteran professional in stunning fashion.

games.description: Sota Fujii's breakthrough game that announced him as a generational talent. At just 14 years old, Fujii played moves so deep that even AI engines took time to understand them. This game marked the beginning of his record-breaking winning streak and is studied worldwide as an example of modern Shogi brilliance.
